alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake Valley; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 2:34PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Weber...eastern Salt Lake...east central Davis...Morgan...west central Summit and northern Utah Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 233 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Granite, or near Sandy, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, Sandy, Murray, Bountiful, Morgan, Draper, Cottonwood Heights, Midvale, Holladay, Summit Park, Little Cottonwood Canyon, Millcreek, Granite, Mill Creek Canyon, Cottonwood West, East Canyon State Park, Emigration Canyon, Mount Olympus, Little Cottonwood Creek Valley and East Millcreek. This includes the following highways... Interstate 84 between mile markers 94 and 114. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 125 and 141. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A severe thunderstorm watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northern Utah.

area.areaDesc: Salt Lake Valley; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
